content.html_text:
• Determine Location of Pregnancy
    • Intrauterine
    • R/O ectopic pregnancy
  • Determine Viability
    • Firmly Establish EDD
    • Nonviable- treat- see value points
  • Evaluate number of sacs for multiple gestation

Value Based Imaging
  • Limit the number of ultrasounds to confirm pregnancy to one
  • Preferred site of service for imaging is office based if possible, if not imaging center
Value based treatment of Ectopic Pregnancy
  • Diagnose early-unruptured
  • Preferred treatment is medical
    • Recommend methotrexate
  • If surgical treatment is needed,
    • Avoid ER visit
    • Direct admit to OR
  • Preferred surgical treatment-Outpatient & Laparoscopic
Value based treatment of Non Viable Intrauterine pregnancy
  • Preferred treatment is medical
    • Recommend Misoprostol
  • if surgical treatment is needed , avoid hospital, site of service is In Office or Ambulatory Surgery Center

The contents of the Touch Point Algorithms, such as text, graphics, images and other material contained in the documents are proprietary and confidential. The reproduction, copying or redistribution of materials are prohibited and may not be duplicated without permission.
Repeat HCG in 48 hours or greater until > 1500 mIU/ml or plateau of HCG values
Confirmation of viability, Establish EDD as equal to LMP or adjust
Sac less than dates, slow FH, no IUP

content.sub_title: Nonviable IUP or ectopic pregnancy Treatment
content.html_text: i) Surgical treatment - D&C or treatment of ectopic ii) Medical Treatment - misoprostol or methotrexate
Order Flu vaccine (seasonal) See Document TPA 2 Doc 1

Add Nuchal Translucency for NIPT screening

In Network preferred test

  • LabCorp: Informaseq MaterniT21
  • Quest: Qnatal advanced
    • li>Bioreference: Claritest Rocheli>(Ariosa)Harmony
Baseline CMP 24 hr urine total protein/creatinine clearance
Early screening for gestational diabetes at 24 weeks or earlier

• BP > 160/105
  • Treat with generic medication
  • Methyldopa
  • Labetalol
  • Nifedipine
  • See ACOG Practice Bulletin:Chronic Hypertension in Pregnancy; Table 2
BP > 140-159/90-109 Do not treat with medication, Consider stopping HTN medications
Start low dose Aspirin 80 150mg daily No later than 16 weeks
History Glucose control preconception review glucose logs (3 months) HbgA1C <7%; ideally <6.5%)
insulin pump multiple daily doses Folic acid 5mg/day until neural tube closes (17 weeks) Low dose Aspirin 81mg/day to begin by 16 weeks
Screening by cardiologist if one or both below -->35YO duration of diabetes >15 years

• HbgA1C TSH & Thyroid Peroxidase antibodies CMP
  • 24hr urine total protein and creatinine clearance

• HbgA1C: elevated
  • change insulin regimen
  • TSH/Antibodies: Review TPA 2F CMP
  • 24hr Urine/Creatinine: Referral to Nephrologist
Daily kick counts Growth scans 28,32,36 weeks Twice weekly testing with NST &BPP beginning at 32 weeks

• Gestational age at delivery
  • history of preterm birth
  • history of PPROM
  • history of cervical insufficiency

start progesterone therapy between 16-24 weeks (ideally by 20 weeks) OR 17HP 250mg weekly injections OR Vaginal progesterone 200mg daily

Review initial prenatal lab results & genetic carrier screening results

• Cell Free Fetal DNA (NIPT) Between 10 weeks and end of pregnancy
  • In Network preferred test
    • LabCorp: Informaseq MaterniT21
    • Quest: Qnatal advanced
    • Bioreference: Claritest Roche (Ariosa)Harmony
Is it abnormal or no call?

• Assessments each visit Weight gain (calculate total weight gain)
  • BP
  • Urine dipstick for at least glucose, protein
  • Fundal height
  • Fetal heart rate (necessary by 12 weeks)
  • Education
Are there any abnormal prenatal findings?

content.sub_title: Evaluation of abnormal prenatal visit findings

content.html_text:
• Assess for nausea
  • vomiting Hyperemesis
  • Add Ketones to urine dipstick

• ACOG algorithm for treatment of nausea and vomiting*
  • See ACOG Practice Bulletin:Nausea and Vomiting in Pregnancy; Figure 1
